paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR V122I variant, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Clinical impact likely occurs in the seventh decade of life or later.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: It appears that in the heterozygous state the allele is clinically silent until the seventh decade of life or later.

functional_data.summary: The TTR V122I variant is associated with decreased stability of the TTR tetramer, leading to amyloid deposition.

variants.segregation_data: The allele is clinically silent until late in life, suggesting it may not segregate with disease in younger individuals.
variants.population_frequency: 0.0253 in high-prevalence West African countries; 0.0173 in African Americans.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on population studies and clinical associations.
variants.additional_notes: The allele frequency is significantly higher in West Africa compared to other regions.
key_quotes: The allele represents a significant risk for congestive heart failure late in life.
The allele does not influence survival to adulthood and is unlikely to be under positive or negative selective evolutionary pressure.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR V122I variant was extracted from the main text.
